text:
I have question about <code> and <pre> into blog post

- I would like to escape {{ and }}
- I would like to style code like in GitHub

Does anyone have ideas ?

Hi all.
Working on my first HubSpot website but I am running into an issue.
I have 3 blog's that I have combined into a single overview.

Now I want to filter those blog's on choice fields I added as module to a blog page. But I can't get the data from the choice field to my overview page.
Anyone an Idea how to make my filters work?

0/ Why did you merge 3 blogs in a single view ? It's more difficult to administrate for my mind

1/ Is the merge of three blog post  made thanks a Website page ?

2/ If you did it I recommand to add a JS function de sort because using blog tag won't work
The client want Blog's | Cases | News as seperate channels. with different templates
ok
understand and you want to filter on a website page by "Blog", "Cases" and "News"

Well all 3 have the same "choice" fields as filter. For example we have a choice called "foo" then when select "foo" on the overview filters only the content with "Foo" is presented on the overview page
1) What is the best way to add the selection boxes to the blog items so Editor van add the filters.
2) How can I expose the value's of the filters on the overview page so I can use them in a data-attribute.
the filter can be the name of your blog and you can add it on a data-attribute and filter by this data-attribute
I has to go deeper that that unfortunatly

Basicly the main question is
- How do I add custom selection field to a blog and how can I expose the value on a overview page.

You can use `{% raw %} {{Code you want to escape}} {% endraw %}` to escape {{}}. As for the styling, there are plugins out there that I've been meaning to check out myself, let me know if you find a good one!
i've always used <https://prismjs.com/> it works well for me
Ok it works also for styling but my code inside {{ }} are not printed in my blog post
halo, there is any way to use `local_dt|datetimeformat('%Y%m%d')` in selectattr filter?

HubSpot design manager is still throwing an error

|regex_replace(‘[!@#$%^&*(),.?“:{}|<>\s]‘, ‘-’)
I think it’s your single quotes
I’ve also tried double quotes and still getting the same error
Also noticed that \t will work but again I am looking to find any white space not just tabs
are you able to reproduce the error? or are you able to use \s in a regex in HubSpots regex replace?
Does any HS DEVs know if there is a File picker option for export_to_template in a Blog post template, I know I can do image, text and choice, but wondering if I can do File picker from File Manager
I dont believe there is <@UF6M5BW4C>
CUSTOM MODULE
:point_up_2::skin-tone-2:
When in doubt, Custom Module it out
hes a poet and dont knowit
<@U38EZFVFE> well a custom module will not help for individual posts, to use custom fields
you can use a custom module just like a hubl tag

but even when using a custom module, I think Chris is looking to be able to use export_to_template_context with a file picker field. If I am not mistaken, putting it in a custom module will still render html of some sorts in the post (even if its blank)
Unless you use no_wrapper on the custom module HubL tag and then reference it with HubL that way using the widget data
you can output as a variable
`{% set file = module.file.url %}`
somethihng like that
yup, I would think using that with also using the no_wrapper on the module itself when called would be the exact workaround to get this to function right
Hi, anyone know if I can use this function crm_objects to get info of ticket by lead?
Currently, you'll need to know the ticket id or search by some attribute of the ticket. You cannot yet list by associations to users.
